Title:
Molecular and morphological recognition of two subalpine
Sparassis species in southwestern China.
Abstract:
Phylogenetic analyses inferred by the sequences of the
internal transcribed spacer (ITS), the nuclear gene coding for the
ribosomal large subunit (nLSU) and partial gene coding RNA polymerase
subunit II (rpb2) strongly supported groups corresponding to
morphological features and suggested a close relationship among S.
subalpina, S. brevipes and S. miniensis. Sparassis subalpina is
morphologically distinct from all other species in the genus
Sparassis.
